titles.title: Kindaichi Shounen no Jikenbo Returns (2015)
(ملفات قضايا الشاب كيندايتشي تعود (2015
金田一少年の事件簿R[リターンズ] (2015)
The Case File of Young Kindaichi Returns (2015)
金田一少年事件簿R 2期

anime.description: Based off of the original manga by Seimaru Amagi, and Fumiya Sato, The Files of Kindaichi Returns centers on the Hajime Kindaichi, grandson of the famous detective Kosuke Kindaichi. Though he usually appears to be a regular high school student, when a difficult case arises Hajime, along with his childhood friend Miyuki Nanase, police inspector Isamu Kenmochi, and rival Kengo Akechi, use their sharp deduction skills to solve each mystery. Source: crunchyroll

tag.name: detective
tag.description: A detective is an investigator, generally either a member of a law enforcement agency or as an individual working in the capacity of private investigators, tasked with solving crimes and other mysteries, such as disappearances, by examining and evaluating clues and records in order to solve the mystery; for a crime, this would mean uncovering the criminal`s identity and/or whereabouts. In some police systems, a detective position is achieved by passing a written test after a person completes the requirements for being a police officer; in others, detectives are college graduates who join directly from civilian life without first serving as uniformed officers. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: China
tag.description: China, officially the People`s Republic of China (PRC), is a unitary sovereign state in East Asia and the world`s most populous country. It is the third- or fourth-largest country by total area, depending on the source consulted. China also has the most neighbor countries in the world. Governed by the Communist Party of China, it exercises jurisdiction over 22 provinces, five autonomous regions, four direct-controlled municipalities (Beijing, Tianjin, Shanghai, and Chongqing), and the special administrative regions of Hong Kong and Macau. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Hong Kong
tag.description: Hong Kong, officially the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region of the People`s Republic of China, is an autonomous territory on the eastern side of the Pearl River estuary in East Asia, south of the mainland Chinese province of Guangdong, and east of the special administrative region of Macau. Hong Kong is the fourth-most densely populated region in the world. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: 金田一少年の決死行 File.4
The Death March of Young Kindaichi, File 4
Voie sans retour pour Kindaichi ! Dossier 4
Kindaichi Shounen no Kesshi Gyou File. 4
episode.summary: Having solved the mysteries, Kindaichi reveals how he was framed for murder, and who the Count of Monte Cristo really is! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 金田一少年の決死行 File.3
The Death March of Young Kindaichi, File 3
Voie sans retour pour Kindaichi ! Dossier 3
Kindaichi Shounen no Kesshi Gyou File. 3
episode.summary: The Count of Monte Cristo claims another victim, but Kindaichi has this mystery solved. Will he be able to reveal the answer before he`s arrested for murder? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 金田一少年の決死行 File.2
The Death March of Young Kindaichi, File 2
Voie sans retour pour Kindaichi ! Dossier 2
Kindaichi Shounen no Kesshi Gyou File. 2
episode.summary: After everyone sees Kindaichi stab Detective Akechi, he`s confined to his room, even if he might have done it in a hypnotic trance. However, Kindaichi`s not going to let that stop him from getting to the bottom of this case! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 金田一少年の決死行 File.1
The Death March of Young Kindaichi, File 1
Voie sans retour pour Kindaichi ! Dossier 1
Kindaichi Shounen no Kesshi Gyou File. 1
episode.summary: Kindaichi goes to Hong Kong in search of Hell`s Puppeteer. He attends a magic show by "Maskman," a name that the Puppeteer has used in the past. But Maskman hypnotizes him, and he starts to feel faint. When he wakes up, he`s walking down the hallway of an empty building, and there`s a dead body in the room behind him... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Ending 1
Opening 1
薔薇十字館殺人事件 File.2
The Rosenkreuz Mansion Murders, File 2
Barajuujikan Satsujin Jiken File. 2
episode.summary: The plot thickens as the guests find themselves trapped in Rosenkreuz mansion, with more victims soon to fall. Who is the killer behind it all? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 薔薇十字館殺人事件 File.1
The Rosenkreuz Mansion Murders, File 1
Barajuujikan Satsujin Jiken File. 1
episode.summary: Hell`s Puppeteer has a sister, and he wants Hajime`s help to protect her. Will they be able to work together to save her from the master of Rosenkreuz Mansion? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 血溜之間殺人事件 File.2
The Blood Pool Hall Murder, File 2
L`affaire du meurtre de la salle de la mare de sang, dossier 2
Chidamari no Ma Satsujin Jiken File. 2
episode.summary: Someone set up an elaborate Go-based murder scene in just 5 minutes, but everyone has an alibi? Kindaichi finds the clues to break one alibi and nab the killer! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 血溜之間殺人事件 File.1
The Blood Pool Hall Murder, File 1
L`affaire du meurtre de la salle de la mare de sang, dossier 1
Chidamari no Ma Satsujin Jiken File. 1
episode.summary: While at a Go tournament, one of the players gets killed. Who could have done this, and why? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 午前4時40分の銃声
Gunshot at 4:40 AM
Gozen 4 Ji 40 Pun no Juusei
episode.summary: A young detective, shot with her own gun. Three suspects, each with an airtight alibi. Can Kindaichi solve this seemingly impossible murder? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 薔薇十字館殺人事件 File.5
The Rosenkreuz Mansion Murders, File 5
Barajuujikan Satsujin Jiken File. 5
episode.summary: At last, the trick behind the Rosenkreuz Mansion murders is revealed! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 薔薇十字館殺人事件 File.4
The Rosenkreuz Mansion Murders, File 4
Barajuujikan Satsujin Jiken File. 4
episode.summary: An offhand comment gives Kindaichi the key to everything that`s been going on at Rosenkreuz Mansion! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 薔薇十字館殺人事件 File.3
The Rosenkreuz Mansion Murders, File 3
Barajuujikan Satsujin Jiken File. 3
episode.summary: The guests still trapped in the mansion each receive a letter from Rosenkreuz, ordering them to be at a specific location at a specific time. What is the enigmatic mastermind setting them up for? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 明智警部の事件簿
The File of Inspector Akechi
Akechi-keibu no Jikenbo
episode.summary: Miyuki and Kindaichi hear the story about how Inspector Akechi was a really cool mentor to a young policeman named Kobayashi. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 雪鬼伝説殺人事件 File.2
The Legendary Snow Demon Murders, File 2
Yuki Oni Densetsu Satsujin Jiken File. 2
episode.summary: It seems death doesn`t take a holiday, as the mysterious disappearance at the Snow Goblin Ski Resort is followed by a gruesome murder. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 雪鬼伝説殺人事件 File.1
The Legendary Snow Demon Murders, File 1
Yuki Oni Densetsu Satsujin Jiken File. 1
episode.summary: Kindaichi and Miyuki get the opportunity to go to a ski resort free of charge! But then, trapped on a snowy mountain with no chance of escape, people start disappearing... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 金田一少年の事件簿R Special 明智警部の事件簿 予告
PV: The File of Inspector Akechi (30 sec)
Kindaichi Shounen no Jikenbo Returns Special: Akechi-keibu no Jikenbo Yokoku
消えた金メダルの謎
The Mystery of the Missing Gold Medal
Kieta Kin Medal no Nazo
episode.summary: The Gentleman Thief sends a note threatening to steal a gym owner`s prized gold medal! Kindaichi and the police stand guard ready to catch the infamous scoundrel, but then tragedy strikes! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 女医の奇妙な企み
The Strange Plan of the Female Doctor
Joi no Kimyou na Takurami
episode.summary: While Kenmochi and Kindaichi are at a hospital for a minor injury, a woman shows up distraught, with her husband nearly dead. But more than a few things seem off... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 雪鬼伝説殺人事件 File.4
The Legendary Snow Demon Murders, File 4
Yuki Oni Densetsu Satsujin Jiken File. 4
episode.summary: Kindaichi reveals who the Snow Demon murderer was, and we learn why they committed the murders! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 雪鬼伝説殺人事件 File.3
The Legendary Snow Demon Murders, File 3
Yuki Oni Densetsu Satsujin Jiken File. 3
episode.summary: Miyuki finds more important clues on Sabaki`s computer... and Kindaichi figures out who the Snow Demon is! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 狐火流し殺人事件 File.4
The Foxfire-Floating Murders, File 4
Kitsunebi Nagashi Satsujin Jiken File. 4
episode.summary: We learn the trick used for the third murder, and the tragic story that motivated it all. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 狐火流し殺人事件 File.3
The Foxfire-Floating Murders, File 3
Kitsunebi Nagashi Satsujin Jiken File. 3
episode.summary: Kindaichi figures out the tricks behind the murders, and calls out the culprit! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 狐火流し殺人事件 File.2
The Foxfire-Floating Murders, File 2
Kitsunebi Nagashi Satsujin Jiken File. 2
episode.summary: After another body is found, Kindaichi realizes the killer has to be one of their friends from cub scouts. But what could the motive possibly be? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 狐火流し殺人事件 File.1
The Foxfire-Floating Murders, File 1
Kitsunebi Nagashi Satsujin Jiken File. 1
episode.summary: Kindaichi and Miyuki are summoned to meet up with some old friends. But it turns out one of them was murdered two months ago! And nobody knows why the rest of them were brought together now... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Ending 2
Opening 2
